description: The Maldives Commissioner of Police, Mohamed Hameed stated on April 20th, 2020 that legal action would be taken against those who spread false information regarding COVID-19, creating fear, and panic among the public. Legal action would be taken against those who harass or spread telltales regarding infected people.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Maldives requires that all academic institutions "to temporarily suspend all activities in campus for 2 (two) weeks," effective March 14, 2020.

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on 31st March, 2020, issued an order effective from 12:00pm 2nd April, 2020 that between 5:00pm and 8pm there is a curfew enforcing stay-at-home orders restricting any and all road traffic (regarding pedestrians and vehicles).

Exception to this rule are law enforcement and health providers and their vehicles, Waste Management Corporation, telecommunications, banks, stelco, and MWSC staff in uniform and on duty and their vehicles, state vehicles with 'G' license boards, diplomatic vehicles, ambulances, individuals with special pass from National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC), individuals working in pharmacies and their vehicles, and vehicles with special stickers from the Health Protection Agency.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on 31st March, 2020, issued an order effective from 12:00pm 2nd April, 2020 that between 5:00pm and 8pm there is a curfew for suspension of all public transport services (bus and ferry).

Exception to this rule are law enforcement and health providers and their vehicles, Waste Management Corporation, telecommunications, banks, stelco, and MWSC staff in uniform and on duty and their vehicles, state vehicles with 'G' license boards, diplomatic vehicles, ambulances, individuals with special pass from National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC), individuals working in pharmacies and their vehicles, and vehicles with special stickers from the Health Protection Agency.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Mar. 12 --- Maldives have ,,declared its first ever state of public health emergency on Thursday, over the COVID-19 pandemic.''

,,Minister of Health Abdulla Ameen stated that the emergency, declared under Section 33 of the 7/2012 Public Health Act, would be in effect from March 12 onwards for a period of 30 days.''

On March 12, 2020 the Maldives Minister of Health, Abdulla Ameen declared a state of public health emergency in Maldives, for a 30-day long period. 

The state of emergency has been extended six times and has now been extended to September 6th, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Feb. 4 --- The government of the Maldives and the Tourism Ministry of the Maldives with the guidance of the Health Protection Agency of the Maldives (HPA) placed a temporary travel restriction for the passengers originating from, transiting to or with a travel history from China.

Maldivians and spouses of Maldivians who are foreign nationals will be allowed in but may be subject to quarantine measures.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
Feb. 4 --- The government of the Maldives and the Tourism Ministry of the Maldives with the guidance of the Health Protection Agency of the Maldives (HPA) placed a temporary travel restriction for the passengers originating from, transiting to or with a travel history from China.

Maldivians and spouses of Maldivians who are foreign nationals will be allowed in but may be subject to quarantine measures. 

On July 15th 2020, the Government of Maldives reopened the borders to allow entry of tourists of all nationalities into the country. UPDATE: On July 15th 2020, the Government of Maldives reopened the borders to allow entry of tourists of all nationalities.

    Maldivians and spouses of Maldivians who are foreign nationals will be allowed in but may be subject to quarantine measures.

description:
Mar. 11 --- Authorites of Maldives have placed the islands resorts of Kuredu, Vilamendhoo, Batalaa and Kuramathi under temporary quarantine. Schools have been closed as a precaution.

“Transfers to and from the islands have been suspended,,
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that all individuals are prohibited from the use of vehicles for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defense Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre are exempted.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that public transportation services are to be temporarily halted for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defence Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC) are exempted.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that travel to and from Male'. Villimale', and Hulhumale' is prohibited, for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defence Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre are exempted.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that all individuals are to stay home for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defense Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre are exempted.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives on April 15, 2020 issued a notice that all individuals are to stay home for a period of  24 hours which was later extended to April 16, 2020 for another 24 hours.

Members of the Maldives Police Service and Maldives National Defense Force, Health professionals, and individuals and media staff provided with a special pass from the National Emergency Operations Centre are exempted.

The lock down has been extended since April 16th, through two extension notices, until May 28th, 2020. UPDATE: The lock down period was extended until My 28th, 2020, by the Health Protection Agency.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih of Maldives, announced during a cabinet meeting on April 13th, 2020 that a "National Taskforce on Resilience Building and Economic Recovery" would be created  to prepare for the eventual lifting of the 'State of Public Health Emergency' imposed in response to the ongoing global COVID-19 pandemic
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mar. 12 --- ,,The Maldives government says it has built the world's first coronavirus resort to quarantine patients on an island called Villivaru in the Kaafu Atoll, about 24km (15 miles) north of Malé, the capital city. ''
type_text: The Maldives government says it has built the world's first coronavirus resort to quarantine patients on an island called Villivaru in the Kaafu Atoll, about 24km (15 miles) north of Malé, the capital city.

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, issued a notice for all guesthouses and city hotels operating in Maldives to suspend all tourist check-ins, effective from March 31, 2020, 6:00 pm.

Tourists who have already checked in shall be allowed to stay for the duration of their booking.
type_sub_cat: Commercial Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih of Maldives announced that all government offices would be shut down for a period of one week from March 19 - 26th 2020, as a precaution against the spread of corona virus.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih of Maldives announced the closure of government offices starting on April 15, 2020 for a 14 day period. This period was extended twice until May 28th, 2020.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Director General of Public Health, Maldives, on 31st March, 2020, issued an order effective from 12:00pm 2nd April, 2020 that outside of the hours between 5:00pm and 8pm congregations of more that three people are not allowed in public.

Exception to this rule are law enforcement and health providers and their vehicles, Waste Management Corporation, telecommunications, banks, stelco, and MWSC staff in uniform and on duty and their vehicles, state vehicles with 'G' license boards, diplomatic vehicles, ambulances, individuals with special pass from National Emergency Operations Centre (NEOC), individuals working in pharmacies and their vehicles, and vehicles with special stickers from the Health Protection Agency.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
